channel.title: lioss on Lioss: License Identifier for OSS
channel.description: Recent content in lioss on Lioss: License Identifier for OSS

item.title: :smile: About
item.description:
📜 License Do What The F*ck You Want To Public License
WTFPL permits 👍 Commercial use, 👍 Modification, 👍 Distribution, and 👍 Private use. 👨‍💼 Developers 👩‍💼 Haruaki Tamada GitHub

item.title: Install
item.description: 🍺 Homebrew lioss is distributed via Homebrew on macOS platform. brew install tamada/brew/lioss Go lang We can install lioss using go get command. Type below command, then lioss and mkliossdb are installed into ~/go/bin directory. go get github.com/tamada/lioss 🛠️ Build from source If you would build from source, you should clone repository from GitHub and compile source codes, like below. git clone https://github.com/tamada/lioss.git cd lioss make

item.title: Usage
item.description: lioss lioss identifies license names of specified project directories, zip file and/or LICENSE files. lioss version 1.0.0 lioss [OPTIONS] <PROJECTS...> OPTIONS --dbpath <DBPATH> specifying database path. -a, --algorithm <ALGORITHM> specifies algorithm. Default is 5gram. Available values are: kgram, wordfreq, and tfidf. -t, --threshold <THRESHOLD> specifies threshold of the similarities of license files. Each algorithm has default value. Default value is 0.75. -h, --help print this message. PROJECTS project directories, and/or archive files contains LICENSE file.
